# The Industrial Use Cases of Embodied AI Systems

**来源**: [https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-3-031-68256-8_16](https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-3-031-68256-8_16)

---

# The Industrial Use Cases of Embodied AI Systems | SpringerLink

原文链接: https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-3-031-68256-8_16

* [M. Shanmuga Sundari](#auth-M_-Shanmuga_Sundari) 
  [ORCID: orcid.org/0000-0001-5755-474X](https://orcid.org/0000-0001-5755-474X)[28](#Aff28) &
* [Kisara Rishitha](#auth-Kisara-Rishitha)[28](#Aff28)

Part of the book series:
[Information Systems Engineering and Management](https://link.springer.com/series/17396) ((ISEM,volume 14))

* 857 Accesses

## Abstract

The integration of embodied artificial intelligence (AI) systems into industrial settings has emerged as a transformative force, reshaping conventional paradigms and unlocking unprecedented possibilities across various sectors. This book chapter delves into the multifaceted landscape of industrial applications where embodied AI systems play a pivotal role in augmenting human capabilities, enhancing operational efficiency, and driving innovation. The chapter commences with an exploration of the theoretical foundations and key components of embodied AI, elucidating the amalgamation of physical form and intelligent algorithms. It subsequently navigates through a diverse array of industrial domains, showcasing how embodied AI has transcended conceptual boundaries to become an indispensable asset. Firstly, the chapter investigates the role of embodied AI in manufacturing, highlighting advancements in robotic systems that seamlessly collaborate with human workers to optimize production processes. It examines how these intelligent agents contribute to flexible automation, adaptive manufacturing, and precision assembly, fostering a symbiotic relationship between human expertise and AI efficiency. Moving beyond manufacturing, the chapter investigates the application of embodied AI in logistics and supply chain management. It explores how autonomous robots equipped with AI capabilities are revolutionizing warehouse operations, inventory management, and order fulfillment, thereby mitigating operational bottlenecks and enhancing overall supply chain resilience. The discussion extends into the realm of healthcare, elucidating how embodied AI systems are transforming patient care, surgical procedures, and medical diagnostics. The chapter explores the integration of robotic assistants in healthcare settings, emphasizing their role in precision surgery, rehabilitation, and patient monitoring. Furthermore, the chapter delves into the energy sector, elucidating how embodied AI contributes to the optimization of energy production and distribution. It explores the deployment of autonomous systems in power plants, predictive maintenance of critical infrastructure, and the implementation of smart grids to enhance overall energy efficiency. Throughout the exploration of these industrial use cases, the chapter critically assesses challenges, ethical considerations, and future prospects associated with the widespread adoption of embodied AI systems. It concludes by envisioning a future where these intelligent agents become integral collaborators, driving innovation, efficiency, and sustainability across diverse industrial landscapes.
